page.title: 06UPPER DOVERCOURT
page.content: Dovercourt has a lengthy{history,}as can be seen by it's name which may be based on the Old Celtic word "doer" or "dwrr" meaning water.It is also mentioned in the original{Domesday {Book}as having been held by the brother of Harold Godwinson,whose name was Ulwin.We presume that Ulwin died at the Battle of Hastings but we are unable to prove this.However at the time of the original survey the land had been given to the DE Vere family, and was held to be worth the princely sum of 12 pounds per annum.An interesting piece of{local history. Today Upper Dovercourt is made up largely of{housing}with an expanding new estate.It is separated from Parkeston by the Ramsey River and the Upper Dovercourt{by-pass}designed to take the heavy ferry traffic away from the town.
